result.execSummary:
The defendant James J Conklin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: To pay restutition plus any statutorily authorized surcharges. (restitution has been paid in full from cash bond posted)
No contact with victim B.B. or 3860 Glidden Drive.

Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.   Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin and pay a DNA surcharge.

To pay the costs of the action on each count. Cash bond applied.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

timeConds.notes: STAYED as long as defendant is complying with conditions of his probation. If stay is lifted, huber release is granted.

defendant.name: Conklin, James J

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: to B.B., check #10394.  (check forwarded to victim through DA's office)

Defendant James J Conklin in court.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Minute sheet. Court reviews events in file. Defendant is accepting the State's offer, ready to conclude matter today.   State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to Cts. 1 & 2. Defendant stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds pleas made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds guilty of Cts. 1 & 2. Court dismisses Ct. 3 but reads in for sentencing. Bond is no longer in effect.
Status conference on October 10, 2016 at 09:45 am.

Defendant James J Conklin in court.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel.   Defendant wants to try to resolve matter with DA, waives right to Counsel.  Court questions Defendant, finds defendant competent to proceed, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver.  Defendant to make appointment with DA.  Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for September 30, 2016 at 10:30 am.
No contact direct or indirect with B.B. or 3860 Glidden Drive.   To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving the Justice Center.

Defendant James J Conklin appears by video.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant indicates he does not qualify for PD representation.  State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond. Return 8/29/16 at 10:00 am.
